text: hazy orange to amber colour, large, dense, stable yellowish off-white head; aroma of resiny-citrusy-biscuity-marmalade notes;taste of resiny-orange zest bitterness, biscuity-tropical fruity sweetness, marmalade bittersweetness and peppermint(?) notes; good one!

Pours a huge foamy off white head that sticks around for a while. Nice dirty, patchy lacing. Has a dark golden appearance. Aromas of floral, citrus and cascade hops. Light bready malts and the rye as well. Flavours are of citrus, cascade and goldings hops, somewhat lemony. Good combination of barley malts and yeast. Rye is very much at the forefront. This ones quite yummy and too easy to drink :)

Ambar, oscura. Espuma blanquecina, poco abundante. Rico aroma, bizcocho, lúpulo. En boca es muy sabrosa. Excelente base malteada, y potente contrapunto lupulado, pino, uva. Gana el lupulo con amargor notable en el post-trago, aunque también se paladea el azucar... ummm. Muy interesante.

0,341l bottle at home bought from Beer Republic. No obvious BB date. 6.6% ABV. copper / redish hazy color, medium big off-white head. smells of caramel, spices, peppery, some berry notes, some old hoppy notes. ok smell old hop notes are a bit disturbing. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes citric, earthy, peppery, some caramel, tobacco, light exotic fruits, some berry notes. finishes medium earthy bitter with notes of tobacco, berry notes and some peppery notes. rather old hoppy, but somehow apart from the old hoppy notes still quite enjoyable to drink. i think its the nice carbonation and the combination of earthy hops. overall nice one.
On tap. Copper color with white head. Grain, caramel and hoppy aroma. Sweet, caramel, grain, fruity, hoppy taste. Medium body.

This beer is a dark copper color with a medium thick off-white head that recedes gradually to an outer ring. Stringy lacing. Aroma of floral hops, malt and rye. Medium body with flavors of herbal hops, fruit and spicy rye malt. The finish is floral and spicy with a rye and hops aftertaste. Pretty good overall.

Surprised I havent rated, drank many times... Great rye and floral smell beautiful spicy rye flavour coupled with tons of bitter hops, great complex aftertaste, medium body and unique malts made me come back again and again.

On tap. Purs a big creamy head, with medium retention and a ggod lace. Aroma of citrics, almonds, cloves, honey, something I cant tell, it maybe the rye, but Ive never smelled rye :-( Medium body, crfeamy palate, strong carbonation. Taste of almonds, citrics, honey, and again that something that I really dont know what it is. good.

Tap.
@ Irreale, Madrid, Spain.
A: Amber.
T: Hops, malt, rye, bitter, sweet, slightly resinous.

Botella. @La Taberna de Hank, Luanco. 06/08/2016
Color ambar, aromas caramelo, sabor caramelo malta, final amargo.

341 mL Bottle. Murky deep gold body with a small white head settling to a film leaving ample stringy lace. Banana, caramel, and clover come through in the aroma; an innuendo of pine needles, delightfully sweet. Flavor of sweet light malts and orange peel, strong citrus hops in the aftertaste, and a hop-bitter and very subtly camphoric finish. Ill add my own honorable mention to the gold medal it won.
Hazy light brown colour with thin head. Has that typical smooth texture that comes from the rye. Flavour has rye and is rather hoppy and bitter.

Bouteille achetée à La Mise En Bière - De couleur ambrée trouble avec une fine mousse beige qui tient longtemps - Au nez des arômes de houblons, résineux, pin, herbacé, infusion de thé, légèrement agrumeux, bien malté, biscuit, caramel, un bon équilibre entre malt et houblons - En bouche toujours beaucoup de houblons, herbacé, pin, résine, légèrement terreux et agrumeux, le malt est aussi toujours bien présent, biscuit, caramel, seigle qui apporte une certaine onctuosité - Corps moyen, amertume forte, carbonation correcte, amère et onctueuse, final amère, herbacée et biscuit - une IPA au seigle bien comme il faut

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2016 Caña en el Lupulo 07..05..2016. (r138). Color ámbar miel con espuma beige. Aromas y sabores a cereales fuertes y rústicos con dosis de herbaceos verdes y frescos acabando en amargo algo seco ligeramente resinoso. Ligeros toques cítricos. Cuerpo medio fácil de beber. Buena.

Rica combinación de maltas de cebada, centeno y lúpulos florales y afrutados. Cuerpo interesante, toque especiado y a frutas cítricas, sobre una fina base de maltas en un conjunto de final seco, ligeramente y floral

Cervesa suau on hi destaquen tant els tocs dolços de les maltes com un lleuger amarg.
Cerveza suave dónde destacan tanto los toques dulces de las maltas como un ligero amargo.
Pours reddish brown, small head. Aroma of grainy malty soy sauce. Taste is malty hoppy, grapefruit peel. not bad, not wonderful.

pours a dark amber with medium white head. subdued hop aroma. some light malt is featured over the semi-balanced bitterness. alcohol flavours are present, but mixes well with the bitterness. finish is a bit harsh, but certainly a pleasant sipping beer.
Tasted from the tap on the 24/10/2015. Copper to orange colour with nice head. Aroma of malts, peach and other citrus. Taste is fresh and clean. Well balanced. Next one please!
Really liked this one. Good amber color with small head. Aroma - malt, citrus. Taste - hops, citrus again, something spicy.
UPDATED: NOV 16, 2015 Surprised that I?m only rating this now considering this is one of my go to beers. Just straight up an amazing beverage.

Tap sample at The Beer Experience in Toronto. Dark amber, small head. Not a big fan of rye IPA-s but really, this ones good! Active carbonatin, dryish finish. Tastes really bitter with a hintingly spicy touch.

0.65 bottle. Clear, dark gold color and a large, creamy, off-white head. Floral aroma of hops, fruits, and obviously flowers. Taste of rye, hoppy bitterness, some malts, and spices. Medium body, creamy texture, and soft carbonation. Finish is more explicit with its features: the rye really shines through, so do fruits. Overall not a bad beer, rather simple but well-balanced and generally pleasant - relatively drinkable too.

Bouteille de 650ml. Superbe bière dorée avec une mousse blanche collante, une belle dentelle colle aux parois. Un nez dagrumes et de houblon terreux. Une bouche amère et douce à la fois, des saveurs dherbes. Une finale longue sur une amertume floral. Une texture crémeuse..wow!

650ml bottle. Clear copper/burnt orange with a frothy beige head. Flavors are rye malt, caramel, grapefruit zest, orange and spruce tips with grassy and spicy notes . Medium body, moderate carbonation, oily texture.
On tap at Erzbierschof Zürich. Aroma of mostly malts, some peach. Mostly bitter in taste, not strong, but filling the whole mouth. Very nice!
Fresh bomber. Nose is rye malt, honey hops, citrus rind, pine. Taste has some rye spice, assertive bitterness, toasted malt, citrus/pine hops. Good stuff.

650ml bottle. Hazy reddish amber colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, off-white head. Spicy rye aroma with citrusy and slightly floral hoppy counterpart, notes of lemon, grapefruit and orange. Taste has some rye spiciness intertwixt with hop bitterness, fruity notes of orange, lemon and grapefruit. Nice, complementary composition.

So, this is my first tik for cams. From a bottle its a big bitter rotting green grapefruit rind impact, wew. Big and bitter, weighs heavily on a double ipa feeling. Boozy alky laced mouth coating brew. Same with the aroma, just a big boozy hopped beer, wew, did I say wew?
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 12oz bottle, thanks to Jeff for the sample. Labeled 6.6%. Mildly hazy orange color. Thin off-white head, some bits of lace. Pleasant toasty malt, rye spiciness, good earthy and floral hop. Bit of biscuitiness. Medium-plus body. Smooth, kind of soft, lighter carbonation. More dry finish. Moderate-plus bitter taste, light sweet. Pretty solid rye IPA.

On tap at Barley Brothers. Pours a clear amber with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a sharp grapefruit note supported by citrus and rye. Flavor has a bit of grapefruit with sweet citrus and a bit of rye.
couleur cuivrée; mousse blanc-crème; arômes fruités; goût malté, fruité et épicé; un peu de résine aussi; texture crémeuse; belle amertume finale; well done !

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ - light hazy bright reddish-orange beer under a solid creamy beige foam; light estery with notes of quince marmalade, lemongrass and tea; smooth mouthfeel,a good malt backbone and fairly bitter, moderate carbonation, pretty dry and long aftertaste of yeast and red fruits marmalade

1pt 6 fl oz bottle from Pantori, San Sebastian. @home 19-05-2015.
BBD: not found. Batch: E0114?
In short: bitter heavy bodied murky ale.
Pours murky orange with frothy off white head. Moderate head retention, some lacing. Citrusy, earthy, pine aromas. Medium body, average carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is fruity, malty, moderate bitter, earthy, resins. Dry and bitter aftertaste. Enjoyable.
Nice Amber colour. Very refreshing but slightly bitter aroma. The flavour is well balanced alcohol, Apple and grapefruit. Very refreshing.

Smell of mango, syrup, hops.Cloudy red colour, high yellow head. Aroma of rye, hops, grass. Some yeast in finish. Very bitter. Flat carbon, slightly oily texture. Mid-light body, surprisingly light actually.
Fast klares bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit einer ordentlichen leicht beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch kräftig mazig, harzig, reife Früchte. Geschmack sehr hopfig, bitter, reife Früchte, Obst, leicht harzig.

Clearish amber color with sufficient foam. The nose is excellent bitter and pale aleish. The taste however is not what I expected. The carbonation shoots the rye in your mouth and leaves an unbalanced tartness that doesnt go away for quite a while. The other guys around the table are quite amazed, so test for yourself.
Very nice amber-orange color with big white stable head. Grapefruit hops, dry rye body. Bitter finish. Rather dry. Wow!

Bottle into IPA glass. Pours a clear amber colour with a finger of off white head. Aroma is fruity hops. Taste is fruity hops with a nice rye spiciness. Excellent beer. I could drink this beer forever.

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

Out of the tap at the grocery store. Citrus nose, but honestly Im starting the fire for grilled fish and I get a lot of smoke too, which I know is just from the charcoal... Strong orange and red grapefruit citrus flavor with some apricot notes. There is a nice rye grain flavor to it, which I really like. I wish that all the Belgian IPAs would just stop and make a Rye IPA instead. Tasty beer.
Cloudy, light amber. Aroma is light fruity character, with a fair bit of yeastiness. Stale malts, bitter, has some yeastiness, and I figure the rye chewiness is ok.

Bouteille de 341 ml achetée à la LCBO (Rockland, ONT) au coût de 2,55$. Arôme: Légère odeur dorange. Apparence: La couleur est orangée voilée avec une moyenne densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col mousseux avec une fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût dorange avec une pointe de seigle. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement huileuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de seigle en arrière goût. (Rating #6052)

Dunkles, ziemlich trockenes Hopfenaroma zu Beginn, das seine blumigen Noten erst im Mittelteil offenbart. Wenig herb, dafür stärker bitter, durchweg getreidig. Süßlich blumiges Ende, in der die trockene Bitterkeit weniger hart erscheint. Wenig süffiges aber doch harmonisches Bier. 11/11/9/11/9/12

750ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki, courtesy of skullgeorge. Almost hazy golden orange color with white head. Malty and hoppy aroma, light fruity, piney and grassy. Taste is sweet and bitter. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Colro cobrizo limpio y espuma color crema uniforme. Aromas cítricos, pino y cereal. Cuerpo medio, inicio de cereal dulce, azúcar moreno y final de amargor cítrico, resinoso y duradero.

Aroma is caramel, slightly roasted and sweet malts. Taste is sweet malts with a smooth roastiness and nice mouth feel paired fairly nicely. Its interesting as the sweet classical ale which transforms into a nice floral, earthy hop profile that finishes smoothly. A good effort.

Camerons RPA was the second Rye Pale Ale I tried and this is the beer that really sold me on the style. It poured a rich bronze with a rich lacy head. I smelled the hops instantly - orange and grapefruit again - with a nice malt base that was both sweet and earthy. Bitter finish. Really good.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2015 Pours hazy to cloudy pale amber with two fingers of pillowy light tan head, excellent retention and chunky lacing. (4/5) Nose is sharp rye, pithy citrus, pine resin, caramel malt, mild tropical fruit. (8/10) Taste is mild sweet, moderately strong bitter. (8/10) Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, lingering and building bitter finish. (4/5)

A very tasty rye pale ale. The rye sharpness works well with the hop bitterness, with just enough sweet caramelly malt to stop it from getting out of hand. The moderately high ABV is completely absent. Yep, I like a good rye pale, and this is a good rye pale. (16/20)

Hazy dark orange with a white creamy lacy lasting head. The fresh tropical fruit smell comes right out of the bottle. Under the fruit there is a nice layer of grain and caramel. Sweet fruity taste with leaves and grain with a bitter hoppy finish. Fresh and bitter and well bananced between the sweet and fruity and bitter hoppy.

Bottle to half-pint glass (shared with the Mrs.). Looks good for the style; a mostly transparent burnt orange with foamy off-white head. Smells of bitter and floral hops with notes of rye spice and a medium-bodied bittersweet backbone. Tastes like it smells with a nice rye tingle. A good example of the style.

Wasnt expecting much of this with its ugly, dated label, but man is this good. Nice colour with a bit of head that disappears faster than my courage in high school. Nose is all flowers and lemon, with a bit of spicy malt hiding in the background. Taste is a solid rye malt with a big hit of flowers and pink grapefruit. Finish is moderately dry. Damn good stuff

Orangée, plutôt trouble, avec un peu de mousse blanche sur le rebord. Le nez est en houblons agrumés, en fruits jaunes et en sucre cuit. Amertume importante en bouche, presque piquante en fin de gorgée, et très persistante. Pendant ce temps, le seigle est présent mais discret, et la rondeur relative des malts est complètement dominée par lastringence des houblons. Une bombe dIBUs sans aucun doute, et sacrément savoureuse bière dun bout à lautre.

It smells American whatever that means. Certainly a strong brew, with a little hippity hop. Maybe De La Soul would enjoy this brew. I find the aftertaste has characteristics of pink grapefruit. I say that in a good way. I can't tell what it smells like . . . a beer? My senses need to pump up the jam a little bit. It's somewhat cloudy in appearance, lots o' lil bubbles racing to the top to form a quality head. One of these 650 ml bottles is good for me. A good brew though.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Opaque amber,fast fading head.Nose of light hops & spicy rye.Bland vague fore & mid, Long, medium strength hop finish

On tap at beer revolution. Pretty cloudy amber/brown and a sustaining off-white cap. Aroma of tropical/passion fruit, caramel, citrus. Taste is a balance of sweet and slight tart bitterness. Slightly creamy mouthfeel, and sticky.
Hazy light copper pour, thin head with some quick dissipating head. pine, citrus,and spicy nose. taste is decently bitter, rye malt comes through with spicy notes. Quite nice.

Pours an amber with a thin off-white head. Nose full of pine and citrus hops, a little rye malt in the back. Taste of pine hops, perfume with a bitter aftertaste that seems to be part and parcel of most rye beers.

Deep golden-orange pour, some haze. Tight and creamy white cap and nice sticky lacing. Nose has rye malts and citrus. Taste has spicy rye malts, orange and citrus notes. Finishes with some grapefruity hops, piney bite/long bitterness. Overall a well done rye ale, nice use of the grain and well hopped, 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, shared at game night. Bright orange, hazy. Very hoppy nose, white grapefruit, light pine. Hoppy palate, more pine, lovely rye character, spicy and bitter. The best Camerons beer Ive had by far!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle from Darbys Liquor Store, Vancouver, 6.6% ABVCloudy amber color with compact head. Very nice aroma of fruity and resiny hops, and later earthy caramel. Good body strength: it has a strong caramel and toffee flavor, with extreme bitterness, a peppery note from the rye, rich of resiny hops, and bitter orange oils.Powerful, very good.

Pours a foggy copper with a white head leaving above average lacing.
Aromas of orange and sweet tangerine. Nice hoppiness 
Taste wise I am getting slightly bitter orange peel offset and complimented by some slightly sweet toffee. Bit of orange candy undercurrent to it all. A very nicely balanced beer.
Orange body with white head and nice lacing. Hoppy aroma. Taste is nicely bitter with a touch of cereal sweetness in the aftertaste. Nice rye ale.

Bomber. Unclear orange copper, off-white foam settles and lasts. Tropical fruity floral aroma. Floral fruity hoppy taste, spicy rye and caramel malts, some citrus and pine, nicely balanced. Average carbonation, medium bodied, well hopped. Very enjoyable PNW hoppy RyePA, this ones a Gooder, but still: NFL (Not For Lagerboys)

Camerons rye pale ale pint no. 864638. This stuff is fantastic. Sweet tangerine, fresh squeezed orange on the warm side, a dude just walked in and had a head pretty much just like the aliens on Aliens. Creepy ass shit. His head is twice as long as anyone in here. Spicy and lime, excellent malts. A very sensory aroma. Always tasted good. Early bitter punch fades for the flavours then pops back in when needed. Lightly spicy early middle, long bitter end. Orangy flavour, lots of rye, earth. Very tasty.
What a fantastic beer. Pours pale golden orange. Great lacing. Preserved oranges... And citrus. Nice sweet and bitter citrus. So good.

Rating #1025 - #stpattysday March 17, 2014, 4oz sample from bottle shared with customers. This was a deep coppery brown coloured pour with a mild tan foam that faded to a ring. Nose was toffee, lemon. Mild alcohol warmth and carbonation (well disguised at 6.5%) Taste is a mild peppery smokiness from the rye grain, mild toffee and caramel malt sweetness, but a boatload of hop punches, citrusy, grassy. Finishes smooth, nice bitterness. Phenomenal rye brew.

On tap at Beer Bistro in Toronto. Nice old English style with a full body and a hoppy balanced flavor. Very nice

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice and easy with a crisp finish and a hint of rye spice. Nice mellow but potent hops on the finish with moderate bitterness. Easy sipping with beauty toffee and caramel flavours, pine and grapefruit too.

Big golden copper pour, scrumptious white foamy head that sticks to sides of the glass. Aroma - earthy, wonderful floral hops, sweet malts...smells really good. Taste - crisp bitterness up front, very smooth, bitter finish with some subtle malty sweetness. Packs a lot of punch, a really well rounded beer.

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2015 Moderate white-tan head on an Orange/cherry hue. Nose is prominent with butterscotch, citrus and bready malt. The zestiness of the rye works beautifully with rich malt, some spiciness and hints of caramel and light fruity hops. The hops linger, but are not out of proportion with the other tastes. A great Rye Pale Ale, and they accomplish great taste without too much alcohol. Arguably Canadas best in this style.

650ml brown bottle. Deep golden-orange pour, some haze. Tight and creamy white cap and nice sticky lacing. Nose has rye malts and citrus. Taste has spicy rye malts, orange and citrus notes. Finishes with some grapefruity hops, piney bite/long bitterness. Overall a well done rye ale, nice use of the grain and well hopped, this is right up my alley!

650ml bottle pours a golden orange color with a 2 finger white head that leaves some decent lacing rings on the glass. Aroma is pine and grapefruit with hints of other fruits possibly pineapple. Taste is a bold pine and grapefruit hop bitterness with a tropical fruity and malty sweetness. Medium bodied with nice carbonation. A well done pale ale that definitely worth sampling.

Citrus aroma with notes of malt. Dark copper colour, slightly opaque. Quick flavour of orange peel on the front, immediately followed by a strong bitterness, with a clean finish. Medium body with mild carbonation. A beer that demands attention and thought
Very cloudy orange beer with a fairly thick head that dissipates slowly. Fairly bitter IPA, with strong citrus hoppy notes

650 mL bottle from the brewery, served in a stem glass. Pours clear caramel-amber with a large, fluffy straw coloured head that remains and laces well. The nose has big notes of fresh hops, with grapefruit and pine. There are also notes of rye, pepper and biscuity malts, but these are secondary to the hops. The flavour is quite bitter throughout with resin and grapefruit. Rye and malts peek through, but are overpowered. Towards the end, bitterness picks up and it closes with a long, resinous hoppy finish with some rye notes. On the palate, it is medium in body with a dry texture and average carbonation. Overall, this is a nice hoppy pale ale with rye notes. The nose is nice and fresh with big citrus and pine, and the rye adds a nice accent. I felt that the hops were a little too dominant through the body, however, hiding the malts. A very nice brew overall though. 2013-05-12

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2015 bottle. Poured hazy amber-orange with a large beige head. Aroma of citrusy hops. Medium body with a crisp bite, finishes with a tart dryness. Mainly hop forward,  lemony note with sweet caramel malt and a touch spicy at the end.

Une bouteille de 65 cl bue dans mon camp de chasse. Une robe cuivrée ou orangée : je narrive pas à me décider. Une belle petite mousse crémeuse qui ne simpose pas. Un nez bien malté, fait de caramel terreux et de toffee avec une évidente signature du seigle et des houblons qui suintent aussi les épices. Sur les papilles, des saveurs de houblons floraux et poivrés qui font vibrer toute la structure caramélisée. En bouche, un liquide qui montre un corps moyen-fort avec un pétillement modéré et une texture franchement crémeuse. Une finale de toute part amère sur dintéressantes notes florales et piquantes.

Bottle - 650ml. Nice, cloudy dark gold body with a thin off-white foamy/creamy head. Rich malty/hoppy aroma witj butterscotch, yeasty, and honeyish hints. Its sharp hoppy taste carries citrusy, grainy, and coriander notes. Ends with a robust, long bitter finish. Very enjoyable.

650 ml bottle. Pours a veiled pale brown with a short lived white head. Aroma is rye, spice, hops, fruits. Flavor is very spicy, malty, caramel, whole wheat bread. Finish is floral hops, citrus, nice bitterness. Lingering bitterness and spices. Medium to strong body, soft and sticky mouthfeel, average carbonation. Very enjoyable.

65 cl bottle, Calgary, AB, Canada via Toronto. Hazy amber colour, noticeable carbonation. Thick head. Nice aroma, floral with spruce and honey. Smooth, sweet, then a strong but not overly sharp resinous flavour. More sweetness on the finish, with a long bittersweet tongue stinging end.

Thanks to cfrancis for this one. Pours a hazy pale orange with a frothy  off white head and nice lacing. Aroma of spicy rye malts, citrus, tropical fruits and some floral notes. Taste is spicy rye, citrus hops, grapefruit, passionfruit and a smooth well balanced bitterness on the finish. Very well balanced beer that super easy to drink.

Pours a cloudy golden orange colour, with a small sticky off white head that leaves good amounts of lace up the glass. Aroma is sweet tropical fruits, citrus, floral, nice mix of grain to balance out and a definite rye presence(bit spicy wheat like). Flavours are resin, grapefruit, tropical fruits, spicy grain, medium bitterness, and toasted grain notes.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2014 Amber orange in colour. Looks great in a glass. Full of flavour with a dry and bitter mouth full. Not enough rye in it to make it stand out different then IPA however it is a very good tasting IPA. Best beer I have tasted from Camerons. Negative thing to say about it is the label could look better,  it looks boring and cheap and a kid could draw it. But the beer inside this bottle is great!!!
650ml bottle. Cloudy copper-red with frothy beige head. Pine, rye, spices, face-squinching grapefruit. Full-bodied and glorious. Lingering finish with a strong alcohol burn.

650ml bottle. Cloudy copper body, medium dense beige head with excellent retention. Gorgeous aroma: citrus, caramel, floral hops, vanilla, yeast, dried apricots and dates. Taste is moderately bitter: resins, caramel, grains, rye bread, a healthy dose of herbal hops. Definitely exceeded my expectations.

Pours a hazy copper colour with a robust white head. Aroma notes are dominated by a big citrus, pine, and fruity nose. The tasting notes are impressive, a chaotic mixture of big alpha resin bitterness and bready malts, with a huge rye band to finish. This is a spectacular beer, and I must seek out more rye beers!

cloudy amber-orange in color, with natural effervescence. Head of generous frothy foam with long lasting retention. Aroma of floral citrusy hops and pungent american hops. Flavor reaches excellent balance between bitter and sweet with a pungent, long lasting aftertaste... Ahh! Dry and bitter mouthfeel. Rye should become the new standard in brewing excellency. Many kudos to Camerons.
Bottle, pours a medium copper, aroma is nice and hoppy and so is taste, a nice body and mouth feel, really a solid offering

pours hazy dark golden-orange with a nice off-white head, some retention and lacing. spicy toasted malts, caramel, pine and resin, bit of nuts and smooth toffee and breadiness, graininess and light woodsiness. moderate carbonation, light body - oily, short but assertive piney finish. nice.
Hops and pine cones mixed with cereal and nut aroma, although muted. Medium body, hoppy flavour and a bitter finish. One dimensional, especially considering the style but enjoyable none the less.

Iechyd da Joe. Copper/ber pour with a white frothy head and clinging lace. Syrup, honey malt aroma with bitter hop hints. Malt flavour with a strong peach influence. Syrup texture. Sweet overall. Its a beer that grows on you.

[bottle--thanks, Eric C!]
Sweet strawberries and cream and pine and grapefruit aroma--fresh hops. Slightly hazy amber under a dense, eternal pristine foam that laces the glass. Plenty of hops in the taste--pine and strawberry (Centennial?) complemented by a sweet base malt that has some toffee character but not overmuch. A moderate bitterness is there in the end to balance the sweetness. Medium body, moderate carbonation (could use a touch more), sweet and bitter grapefruit peel finish.

Keg at loose moose Toronto. Slightly hazy amber colour. Not a big aroma, its fruity that's about it. Taste is good though. Sweet, tropical fruits, caramel, grapefruit, good bitterness. Not bad at all. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 oz. bottle, sent from wilco (thanks a lot, Mike), pours a cloudy bright orange with a small off-white head. Aroma of rye upfront, followed by some crystal malt, and subdued hops. Flavour brings out loads of rye upfront, followed by a mix of different hops, and some crisp biscuity malt. Very dominated by the rye, leaving a long astringency. Not the easiest to drink, but well-made.
650 ml Bottle from the LCBO. Pours a hazy amber colour with a generous head. Floral hops aroma. Great beer.

It pours orange with gold highlights, it is translucent (hazy) with a few lees floating about; the head is off-white and mousse-like. The aroma has notes of: pineapple, mango, and toffee. The taste is light sweet that finishes very dry and medium bitter; there are notes of: grapefruit pith, rye, mango, and strange note (I assume from the rye; almost floral). The palate is medium bodied, light carbonation, slightly astringent, and a long bitter finish. Overall, interesting, but the rye isnt pronounced enough to vastly differ it from an IPA.

Poured from 650ML 6.6%bottle. into a tall dicks last rersort glass from Myrtle Beacxh,S.C. Anywho big head,coppy orange,smells lots of lemon kinda like cleaner,some pine and a liottle boosy ior sweet wit a warmth and grapefrut, and grass?. Taste is grape fruite and lemon,tingly tonge,some bitterness,a tad little sweetness and its kinda ruff and gos right to my head and is heavy bodied.  This is for hop heads. Its a stronger flavoured hoppy beer. Not awful but one 650ml bottle is  deff more then enough. Its another type of ipa type beer really with rye.

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2013 Great brew! Well balanced RyePA with some spicy, nutty notes from the rye, nice floral hoppiness and medium bitter finish. Great beer; one of my favourites... wish it was available year round, and in a 6er.

Bottle from the LCBO. Pours a hazy amber with a generous beige head. Floral hops on the nose but not overpowering. Has a quick hit of bitterness that fades gradually with a good balance. The nuttiness from the rye balances the hops.

Red/orange colour with a well laced and frothy head. Hops and pine cones mixed with cereal and nut aroma, although muted. Medium body, hoppy flavour and a bitter finish. One dimensional, especially considering the style but enjoyable none the less.

Reasonably clear and deep golden in colour. Smallish creamy white head which laces well.  Citrus hops are front and centre in the nose. Palate is quite dry, and has a metallic tang from the rye.  Some nice grapefruity back notes. Finishes bone dry and with a boozy warmth.  Would be a good companion for any spicy dishes.

Bottle - Hoppy grapefruit and some spicy sweet malts.  Clear copper thin white head.  Light malts, spice followed by hoppy grapefruit and a quick hit of bitterness that disappears quickly.  Nice and the rye stands out.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle: Poured a clear dark amber color ale with a relatively large foamy head with good retention and some good lacing. Aroma of spicy malt notes with citrusy and spicy hops profile. Taste is a great refreshing mix between some spicy rye notes with some citrusy and spicy hops profile which are close to IPA level. Body is about average with good carbonation and no apparent alcohol. Solid beer which is definitely better then the rest of Camerons standard offerings.

650 mL bottle.  Hazy, rusty orange - colour isnt great - but comes with a nice, fluffy, off-white head.  Aroma - this is not your average rye beer.  There are hops in here.  Almost IPA level in the aroma.  The hops manifest mostly as sweet tangeringe in the flavour, but they are balanced by the spiciness of he rye and a very solid level of bitterness.  Id get a lot more of these if it didnt only come in bombers.
Bottle. Pours orange nice white top. Spicy hop aroma. Taste is spicy citrus and grassy hop

Pours a hazy copper/orange with white head and beautiful lacing. Aroma of bright grapefruits, lemon, light spicy notes. Taste is full on citrusy hops, light piney notes, spicy malts, good bitterness and well balanced. Medium body and medium carbonation. Well done!

Draft at Beer Bistro. Hazy orange pour with a  head thats just nothing special. Strong clover weedy scent. Wow talk about that hop attack. The right to the back of the throat bitterness. This is the happiest pale ale Ive had all night, and Ive had far too many pale ales.

Bomber from lcbo. Gorgeous amber with a slightly off white head. Slight resin, pine, grapefruit, grain, nice malt. Moderate body and carbonation, balanced bitterness, bit off sweetness towards the end, nice and dry. Will be drinking this over the summer.

Bomber from the LCBO and rated as Canadas No. 1 rye beer. Pours a hazy golden-amber colour with a big off-white, frothy cap that has great retention and loads of foamy lace. Fresh Cascade hop aroma with the citrus, like grapefruits. Kind of creamy with the nice head, but gets nicely dry in the finish because of the hop. Lots of citrus in the taste with some oranges, well-blended with the cereal malts and ending with the very bitter grapefruit zest. I can see why it is also in the top 10 list of rye beer (specialty grain) in the world. A very nice surprise, that gets more bitter and bitter with every sip (like pure grapefruit peel).

Bomber from LCBO, served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. Clear, vibrant amber with a nice light tan head. Strong, pungent, peppery, floral, slightly resinous, grapefruit hops, gorgeous hop nose, the rye adds extra peppery character, slightly dusty, sufficient rich, dry malt support, lovely stuff. Medium body, slightly relaxed effervescence. Quite pungent, less floral and fruity, burnt notes, dank and resinous, still fairly peppery and a little dusty, more malt than the nose, very dry, toast, crust, burnt sugar, still quite lovely; dry with good bitterness and a long peppery, floral, pungent finish. Big and beautiful!
Bottle. Pours cloudy orange. Aroma of citrus and pine hops. Taste is very nicely balanced between the rye malts and citrus hops, crisp and lingering at the same time. This was a very nice surprise.

Gorgeous citrus aroma. Good carb, perfect mouthfeel, hazy oranger pour with a thick, sticky head. Flavour really shows the rye. The malts are prevalent and have a slight rye sweetness. A thick pithy citrus bitterness that lingers, and is wonderful. Great stuff!

Pours hazy gold with a frothy white head. Aroma is of citrus, pine, caraway and rye. Taste is quite dry and hoppy, slight bit of caramel malt with a lot of lingering, clean bitterness. Medium body, long finish. Impressive!

Draught @ Beer Bistro, Toronto.
Nice clean, nutty aroma. Clear pour, little head.
Light spicy, sour taste. Dry hoppy finish. Quite sessionable.

Fragrant but not flowery. Peppery bitterness. Long, slightly antiseptic finish. Very nice. 

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2013 Bomber from LCBO.  Pours hazy deep amber with white lacing.  Aroma of sweet grains, strawberry, kiwi, and citrus fruits.  Taste starts off with sweet and spicy grains, moves into slight fruit notes, and ends with a very bitter finish.  Very good stuff!

Large bottle from the LCBO. Pours a light orange-brown with a good amount of head that dissipates quickly and some visible carbonation. Smell is citrus, trees, and some spice. Palate is on the lighter side of medium bodied with a bit lighter carbonation. Taste is slightly sweet at first, then gets bitter, with a spicy aftertaste. Quite nice.
Like the play with genres thats going on here. Earthy, strong & bitter. Nice y

I havent been much of a fan of Camerons brews, but this years (2013) RPA is absolutely delicious! Nice balance of hoppiness and rye tones, smooth with a sharp bitterness that fades into very flavorful brew!

Bottled three days ago, bought from LCBO. Nose explodes great mix of citrus and piney aromas, especially as this warms this smells really resiny. Some spice in the nose as well. Looks a hazy copper/orange color, hard to see through this one. Taste upfront shows off some fruity tropical flavors, pine in the middle and a spicy/bitter finish. The finish could be smoother, this is my first rye pale ale so I dont have much to compare it against. The hop character is great though. Medium bodied and average carbonation.

341ml bottle. Hazy orange/brown, good sized tan head and some sticky lacing. Lively carbonation. Aroma is mostly big American hops with some citrus, orange and spicy rye malt behind that. Taste is much the same with some earthy hops in the back of the mouth as well. Overall, very well balanced and drinkable, lots of good hop flavours.

On tap at Volo 
 Aroma:   high citruss hop notes , clean with slightly grainy (rye) malty behind. Very smooth. 8-
 Apperance:   hazed amber-red with plus sized creamy white top. Good lace. Look at those rings on glass! 4+
 Taste/Palate etc.   Medium bodied , fairly dry for rye based ale. Medium carbonation. Full sided and long finish. Crisp hop character. Softness of rye blended with good dose of hops do wonders here. Quiet impressive stuff.

(on draught at BarHop, 12-22-12) Pours a dark brownish amber with a thin white head that didnt last. Aromas strongly fruity hops (grapefruit pith and juice, peaches), light grass, spices and grainy rye. Flavour is hop-forward at first, with grapefruit dominating and a little pit fruit and faint pine. Rye characteristics come through in the palate, with some toffee giving way to spicy, grainy characters towards the finish. Strong hop bitterness throughout and a very dry finish, with the hops not drowning out the rye which gives a lingering faint roasted nuttiness. Medium bodied, carbonation medium-high. Balance is good, strongly hopped but definitely a RyePA rather than a IPA.
Amber brown color. Very spicy, grapefruits and rye dominate the nose. Very pleasent. Well balanced spicy mouth. Dry moderately hoppy spicy finish. The rye just lingers. Excellent.

On tap at Imbibe. Pours a semi hazy brownish gold with a large beige head. The aroma is quite nice, very sharp hop characters riding on a rich malty body. Flavour is very hop-forward, but with a respectable malt body backing things up. The finish has a minor woody-sharpness that is reminiscent of rye, almost peppery. Lingering sharp hoppy notes dominate the aftertaste. Quite an impressive beer, though it maybe suffers from a lack of drinkability over multiple pints.

550ml draught 
6.6% ABV 
Cest What? (Toronto, Ontario, Canada) 
June 15, 2012 
The beer poured a hazed dark gold with a 1" foamy light tan head.  The aroma was strong citrus hops (I could smell them while the beer was 3 feet away from me), some grains (although not very rye like), and some spices.  The mouthfeel was medium bodied with medium carbonation.  The flavour is heavy on the grapefruit flavours with a nice malt balance, and some zestiness.  I can see why this is being hailed as one of the best IPAs in Ontario.
More PA than belgian or IPA - the dryness is there but its missing some balance or body. Bitterns is ok but not full or interesting, more sharp than balanced.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2015 En fût au Wellington Gastro Pub. 6.6%. Couleur ambrée, mousse beige pâle. Arôme de malt, poivre, houblons, et agrumes. En bouche, fraîche, pamplemousse, agrumes, herbes, seigle, très florale. Finale poivrée, amère et agrumeuse. Excellente et la meilleure RyePA que jai bu jusquà aujourdhui. Bouteille 650 ml. LCBO. Trop de caramel...probablement pas fraîche.

341ml bottle from jsprime. deep ornage with a tan head. huge pungent hoppy nose. the flavour is hop forward, lighter then the appearance would lead you to believe. the finish is super bitter and astringent. 2 note, not complex enough. its good, its not great.

This rye ale poured a cloudy amber colour with a creamy, tan coloured head. Light lacing. To the nose there are scents of grass, pineapple, spruce and bread. First swig was very creamy with flavours of citrus and grass hops. Finish is very bitter but not too overpowering. Palate is just like eating a pile of fresh cut grass.

Deep hazed chestnut with a creamy beige cap of cream puff head. Plenty of lace and head retention to talk about. Spicy nose hints at vanilla, wood, the floral side of hops, burnt sugar. Very high bitterness with balancing malt sweetness is enjoyable. Medium/full body with astringent bitter and spicy finish. An excellent effort.

On draft at Winking Judge in Hamilton. Full body, tastes of toffee, dark crystal to brown malt. Earthy, dank hops, fairly bitter. Carbonation seemed a touch high for the style replaced some of the bite of the bittering hops.
On tap at black tomato. Pours orange with a small initial head and huge lacing. Up front some toffee with some pine and peach in the background. Long bitter finish and medium carbonation. Well done!

A wonderful smell on this one. Has lots of fruity hops, some cherry even. Pours ruby clear with low lacing and low carbonation, a little head. Although the taste doesnt live up to the smell, theres some good veins of rye, hops and grainy bitter here. On cask at volos.

Pours a nice butterscotch toffee brown with a healthy white frothy top.  Aroma is a great earthy/pine hoppiness with the sweet toffee from the malt.  Taste is a bold up front pine hop flavouring with a good amount of bitterness.  Followed by a sweet toffee and butterscotch back end with some earthiness of the malt to round it out.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2016 Gold pour with 2 fingers head.  Juicy hoppy aroma with spice in the background.  Mango and grapefruit up front, rye and spice follows.  Medium body good carb.  Very nice  *EDIT LCBO batches have seemed a bit dumbed down - hop character is now more muted.  docked a notch accordingly*

Butterscotch colour that is quite hazy. Great aroma. The west coast hops combined with the rye malts was really great. Juicy hop flavour with  lots of bitterness. Lots of c-hops as well as wet grass and a slight buttery note on the back. very well balanced with a smooth mouth feel and a bitter finish.

[4387-20120421] Cask. Light evergreen cow notes in the aroma with some floral grains. Slightly hazy, amber orange body with a long-lasting bubbly off-white head. Orange citrus grains flavour has a bitter butter background. Medium-full body. Good but a bit odd at first. (7/3/7/3/14) 3.4
(#12 IPA Challenge @ Volo, Toronto, ON)

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2013 Nice hoppy beer. Light golden with enormous foamy white head.  Hoppy and spicy aroma.Very good drinkability, with a spicy good bitterness.
This one hits the bullseye.
Had with a Radler, grapefruit juice added, nice.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2012 2012-06-30. Did not take notes but this was much fruitier, hoppier and generally more robust than the last time I tried it. Had a couple of pints.  +2 overall. On tap at Bettys, Toronto2012-04-21. Lightly hazy dark amber, near headless body. Modest aroma needs some coaxing, mild malt and hops. 7+ Similar flavour, modest malt character, mild bitterness up front starts low and grows steadily towards the finish, modest resin, lightly leafy hops. It is a bit mild up front but I like it. Average to medium bodied palate is lightly carbonated, but has one of the better palates of the day. 3+ Looking forward to trying this one on tap. Blind Tasting on Cask at Volo IPA Challenge

A reddish copper ale with a thin creamy mocha head. In aroma, a smooth piney floral hops, citrus notes, biscuit malt, light catnip notes. In mouth, a nice resinous hops, grassy and herbal, with caramel malt, pink grapefruits notes, light roasted notes, oily mouthfeel, very nice. On tap at Wellington Gastropub, April 19, 2012.

Draught at Bettys. Pours a cloudy copper-orange with a small lasting frothy off-white head. Decent lacing. Big hop aroma with resiny/fruity/citrusy hops mainly along with some malt in the background. Lovely hoppy flavour, resiny and citrusy hops, along with rye malt, citrusy fruit and a big bitter finish. Medium bodied. Holy shit, Camerons? Wow. Congrats on your best beer yet, keep it up.

-- Rated via Beer Buddy.

April 7, 2012 - on draught at Volo (had three of these!!).  Slightly hazy copper with a solid sticky-looking tan creamy head, thick lacing.  Smells wonderful - like a lush tropical fruit/citrus west coast pale ale/ipa, with some cereal grain to it, hardly any alcohol ... balanced.  Taste - initially a huge whack of grainy bitterness, must be the rye (tastes "red") - sharp, pungent, acidic, the aroma is quite different, as there is not as much fruity/citrus bitterness here, just grain and sharp bitterness .. a bit more alcohol too (also not quite as balanced as the aroma, but still very moreish).  Chewy mouthfeel, solid body, the rye makes it seem very astringent, nice carbonation, and a long pungent top/back palate bitter finish, not boozy, and really easy to drink - and SCORE!  they are bottling this now!

On tap at Volo.  Pours a cloudy amber colour with smallish white head.  Aroma is caramel, citric and piney hops and a bit of graininess.  Flavour likewise, with chewy grapefruity and piney hops balanced nicely by the rye malt.  Decent bitterness in finish.  A nice APA and unquestionably the best Camerons beer Ive had.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2012 Bottle: puts a roily unfiltered golden ale in the glass with a decent cap that lasts and laces. Aroma is west cost IPA with a difference - pungent grapefruit, floral, some cereals, and a great earthy funk (from the rye?). Flavour is all west coast  pale ale but very intense and with a decent body. In a blind test youd call this an west coast IPA - the spoiler is the quick rye spice right at the end of the finish. This is probably the best pale ale made in this local market, the rye component adds to the spicey- citrus complexity which is a matter of hop mixure, rye malt and dry hopping. A fantastic pale.

On tap. Aroma just the way a juicy IPA should be: tropical, citrus, pine, cereal maltiness. Great sticky medium body. Sweet up front and sappy grapefruit tannic bitterness on the finish. Very well balanced. Delicious and chewy. I dont know specifically the effect the rye is having but this is one fabulous pale ale.

On tap at Betty's. Appearance: cloudy amber, small snow white head. Aroma: delicious sharp hoppiness, nice fruit nose too with a malty backbone. Flavour: great big hop wallop, tons of 'em! So fruity and citrus like, very well balanced, wet hops tasted throughout with a deliciously hoppy finish. Great beer.

Tap at The Only Cafe. Pale amber-gold with a thick moussey head. The aroma is great - fresh pine and grapefruit with a touch of soft spiciness in the back. Aggressively hopped with a ton of fresh dank hoppiness over a lean pale malt/rye malt. Damn - I was not expecting this but now that I found it, I want more. Rich fresh hops. This reminds me if Bear Republics Hop Rod Rye mixed with Racer 5 (a combo I used to make when I had a steady free supply I both). Colour me impressed Camerons!

Went into the brewery to buy a case of their Dopplebock. While I was there I chatted with a very nice employee (sorry forget his name) who told me about the launch of their new Rye Pale Ale. Was not yet on sale at the time but he said "wait a minute" and left for the brewery. He came back a minute later with a bottle of the RPA and said "here...give it a try". Great way to promote the beer!!! So here is the review... Colour -Pours a nice hazy amber colour with decent head. Aroma -an incredible nose and probably one of the best I have smelled in a very long time - spice and citrus mixed with the complexity of the hops but all very bold that seems to tickle the nose. The aroma says "wow". Taste -here is were I was a little disappointed and I suppose based on the aroma I was expecting "wow" in the taste and it just wasnt. Spicy/peppery rye was definately evident and the complex hops and malt gave it a spice aftertaste but a very smooth finish. OVERALL -a very good beer and one I would buy again but in my opinion not as good as the Dopplebock.
I enjoyed this Camerons offering in bottle at Food & Drink Fest Hamilton.  The server indicated they hope to have it bottled for sale next year.  A great taste of the rye in a great ale.
